title: Kate Middleton Kurta:The Duchess of Cambridge Pays Tribute To Princess Diana In Traditional 'Kurta' During School Visit In Pakistan
text:
The Duchess of Cambridge, Kate Middleton, has paid a touching tribute to Princess Diana.

For her first meeting in Islamabad, she wore a traditional blue kurta and scarf by Maheen Khan, an international Pakistani costume designer.

AP

Kate Middleton chose a royal blue salwar kameez during the royal couple’s visit to the Islamabad Model College for Girls, on the second day of her visit to Pakistan.

I really I’m loving Catherine’s outfits so far. This color it’s beautiful #RoyalVisitPakistan

📸: Andrew Parsons pic.twitter.com/lLs26kurwz — Isa (@isaguor) October 15, 2019

The Model College for Girls is a government-run school for the disadvantaged, four to 18-year-old kids, benefiting from the Teach for Pakistan programme based on the UK’s Teach First scheme.

AP

The Duchess of Cambridge's took inspiration from late Princess Diana's outfit, back when she had met young cancer patients at a memorial hospital in Lahore in May 1997.

The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge Kate Middleton and Prince William also wore traditional Chitrali hats on their third day of Pakistan tour.

Video: William & Kate were given a book of photos of Princess Diana’s visit here in 1991. The Cambridges have now got back into their helicopter 🚁 to visit the Chiatibo Glacier in Broghil National Park 🗻⛰🏔#RoyalVisitPakistan pic.twitter.com/LGGAakWF4J — Emily Andrews (@byEmilyAndrews) October 16, 2019

William was also gifted a white embroidered coat while Kate was presented a warm shawl. The hat worn by the duchess was adorned with peacock feathers.

According to details, Kate and William will be travelling to the Hindu Khush valley, and also visit Chiatibo Glacier in Broghil National Park to see the devastating effects of climate change.

The British Royals, Prince William (Duke of Cambridge) and Kate Middleton (Duchess of Cambridge) are currently on a five-day long tour to Pakistan.

On Tuesday, October 15, Prince William and Duchess Catherine attended a dinner hosted at the National Monument in Islamabad. For this meeting, Kate wore a glittering emerald green gown. She completed her look with a dupatta and traditional hanging earrings.

The royal couple's visit was organised at the request of the United Kingdom Foreign and Commonwealth Office, to highlight the relationship between the UK and the Commonwealth country.

The five-day excursion of the royal couple is ‘the most complex tour undertaken by The Duke and Duchess to date, given the logistical and security considerations’, the Kensington Palace said in the statement announcing the visit.

“Their Royal Highnesses will also spend time understanding the complex security picture in Pakistan. They will learn more about the challenges and opportunities, both of the past and today. The UK has been a key partner for Pakistan,” it added.
description: Kate Middleton has paid a touching tribute to Princess Diana for the second time in just two days during her royal tour of Pakistan with husband Prince William.She wore a traditional blue kurta and scarf by Maheen Khan, an international Pakistani designer and costume designer.
